methods.name: admin.analytics.getFile
methods.description: Retrieve analytics data for a given date, presented as a compressed JSON file

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of analytics to retrieve. The options are currently limited to member (for grid member analytics) and public_channel (for public channel analytics).

params.name: date
params.description: Date to retrieve the analytics data for, expressed as YYYY-MM-DD in UTC.

params.name: metadata_only
params.description: Retrieve metadata for the type of analytics indicated. Can be used only with type set to public_channel analytics. See detail below. Omit the date parameter when using this argument.Default: false

errors.name: metadata_not_available
errors.description: Metadata not available for the analytics type you provided.

errors.name: metadata_only_does_not_support_date
errors.description: The metadata_only field gets the latest metadata file. The date field is not supported.

errors.name: data_not_available
errors.description: The date was before the API became available.

errors.name: file_not_found
errors.description: The analytics data for the date specified weren't found.

errors.name: file_not_yet_available
errors.description: The analytics data for the date isn't available yet.

errors.name: invalid_type
errors.description: The analytics data for the type specified weren't found.

errors.name: invalid_arguments
errors.description: The method was either called with invalid arguments or some detail about the arguments passed are invalid, which is more likely when using complex arguments like blocks or attachments.

errors.name: invalid_date
errors.description: The date argument was invalid.

errors.name: missing_scope
errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific scope permissions required to complete this request.

errors.name: not_an_enterprise
errors.description: The user token does not belong to an enterprise.

errors.name: not_an_admin
errors.description: The user token does not have admin privileges.

errors.name: feature_not_enabled
errors.description: This feature is not enabled on your workspace.

errors.name: member_analytics_disabled
errors.description: Member analytics are disabled for your organization.

errors.name: org_level_email_display_disabled
errors.description: This API is unavailable for organizations with a 'Hide email addresses' policy.

errors.name: user_cannot_manage_public_channels [hidden]
errors.description: The user must have permission to manage public channels at the enterprise level.

errors.name: not_authed
errors.description: No authentication token provided.

errors.name: invalid_auth
errors.description: Some aspect of authentication cannot be validated. Either the provided token is invalid or the request originates from an IP address disallowed from making the request.

errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace when using a bot token.

errors.name: token_revoked
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace or the app has been removed when using a user token.

errors.name: no_permission
errors.description: The workspace token used in this request does not have the permissions necessary to complete the request. Make sure your app is a member of the conversation it's attempting to post a message to.

errors.description: The workspace is undergoing an enterprise migration and will not be available until migration is complete.

methods.name: admin.apps.uninstall
methods.description: Uninstall an app from one or many workspaces, or an entire enterprise organization.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: app_id
params.description: The ID of the app to uninstall.

params.name: enterprise_id
params.description: The enterprise to completely uninstall the application from (across all workspaces). With an org-level token, this or team_ids is required.

params.name: team_ids
params.description: IDs of the teams to uninstall from (max 100). With an org-level token, this or enterprise_id is required.

methods.name: admin.conversations.search
methods.description: Search for public or private channels in an Enterprise organization.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: cursor
params.description: Set cursor to next_cursor returned by the previous call to list items in the next page.

params.name: limit
params.description: Maximum number of items to be returned. Must be between 1 - 20 both inclusive. Default is 10.Default: 10

params.name: query
params.description: Name of the the channel to query by.

params.name: search_channel_types
params.description: The type of channel to include or exclude in the search. For example private will search private channels, while private_exclude will exclude them. For a full list of types, check the Types section.

params.name: sort
params.description: Possible values are relevant (search ranking based on what we think is closest), name (alphabetical), member_count (number of users in the channel), and created (date channel was created). You can optionally pair this with the sort_dir arg to change how it is sortedDefault: member_count

params.name: sort_dir
params.description: Sort direction. Possible values are asc for ascending order like (1, 2, 3) or (a, b, c), and desc for descending order like (3, 2, 1) or (c, b, a)Default: desc

params.name: team_ids
params.description: Comma separated string of team IDs, signifying the workspaces to search through.

methods.name: admin.conversations.setTeams
methods.description: Set the workspaces in an Enterprise grid org that connect to a public or private channel.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel_id
params.description: The encoded channel_id to add or remove to workspaces.

params.name: org_channel
params.description: True if channel has to be converted to an org channelDefault: false

params.name: target_team_ids
params.description: A comma-separated list of workspaces to which the channel should be shared. Not required if the channel is being shared org-wide.

params.name: team_id
params.description: The workspace to which the channel belongs. Omit this argument if the channel is a cross-workspace shared channel.

methods.name: admin.users.invite
methods.description: Invite a user to a workspace.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel_ids
params.description: A comma-separated list of channel_ids for this user to join. At least one channel is required.

params.name: email
params.description: The email address of the person to invite.

params.name: team_id
params.description: The ID (T1234) of the workspace.

params.name: custom_message
params.description: An optional message to send to the user in the invite email.

params.name: guest_expiration_ts
params.description: Timestamp when guest account should be disabled. Only include this timestamp if you are inviting a guest user and you want their account to expire on a certain date.

params.name: is_restricted
params.description: Is this user a multi-channel guest user? (default: false)

params.name: is_ultra_restricted
params.description: Is this user a single channel guest user? (default: false)

params.name: real_name
params.description: Full name of the user.

params.name: resend
params.description: Allow this invite to be resent in the future if a user has not signed up yet. (default: false)

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.description: Set cursor to next_cursor returned by the previous call to list items in the next page.

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of items to return. Must be between 1 - 1000 both inclusive.Default: 1000

params.name: team_id
params.description: The ID of the workspace you'd like active sessions for. If you pass a team_id, you'll need to pass a user_id as well.

methods.name: admin.users.session.setSettings

params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.description: Terminate the session when the clienteither the desktop app or a browser windowis closed.

params.description: The session duration, in seconds. The minimum value is 28800, which represents 8 hours; the max value is 315569520 or 10 years (that's a long Slack session).
